main event: On October 2nd, 1957, in Brooklyn, New York, a ground radar observation reported 8-10 white objects of varying sizes, lasting approximately 30 minutes, with insufficient data for evaluation and an unknown conclusion.
interesting points: The observation involved 8-10 white objects varying in size, with no information on their course.
The observation was conducted for approximately 30 minutes, indicating a sustained sighting.
The report mentions a description of the objects as 'star blinking' and 'dim flickering'.
The manner of observation included the use of binoculars with a 6x30 Jap coated lens.
Trained observers and pilots were present, providing credibility to the report.
